title: Bloom of Faded Years. [A novel.]
author: Downe, Walmer.
snippet: That wUl suffice for to-day. To-morrow engage a carriage to St. Giles'— Cramond Bridge and the Valhalla of Scotland—touching at the Parliament House and Advocates' Library; then drive out to Queensferry, returning by way of Fettes' College. Then the next day Roslin Chapel and Hawthornden should afford you ample enjoyment."

title: Works of R. L. Stevenson. (Edinburgh edition.) [Edited by Sidney Colvin.]
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: ' The dinner is official,' he explained. ' The officebearers and Senatus of the University of Cramond—an educational institution in which I have the honour to be Professor of Nonsense—meet to do honour to our friend Icarus, at the old-established hoivjs, Cramond Bridge. One place is vacant, fascinating stranger—I offer it to you!'

title: Provost-Marshal: a romance of the middle shires
author: Moncreiff, Frederick Charles
snippet: As he ran fast, he ran far, until, when he had put at least a mile between him and Cramond Bridge, he came to the verge of the thicket. Safe now at least from immediate pursuit, he peered out into the open and drew a long breath; but he had scarcely done so when two arms closed round him like bands of steel, and a shrill whistle at his ear nearly deafened him.
